column1: 100 Accomplishments in 100 Days  Telehealth During Covid: Advocated for Medicare to pay for telehealth during the emergency as well as to include rural health clinics. 1/2

100 Accomplishments in 100 Days  Helped Introduce the Immediate Relief for Rural Facilities and Providers Act -- bipartisan legislation to relieve the growing financial strain faced by overstressed rural health care systems during the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19). https://t.co/w8edHSkrTl

We will not give up on delivering responsible targeted COVID-19 assistance. It’s a shame that Senate Democrats continue to cling to an all-or-nothing strategy instead of getting real help out the door right now.  https://t.co/B25w1HoXrs
Last night Chuck Schumer tried to adjourn the Senate with no #COVID19 relief. Mike Espy's first vote would be to make him Majority Leader.

100 Accomplishments in 100 Days  HELPING OUR FARMERS DURING COVID: The CARES Act has provided significant relief for agriculture. Approximately $16 billion in direct payments to producers (beef pork dairy produce row crop producers and others) harmed by market disruptions. https://t.co/DlTkfkn2yH
In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic our health care providers need more certainty not less. https://t.co/mRSegdiPLG

I encourage all Mississippians to receive their flu shots this year as we continue to face the Covid-19 pandemic. Receiving these shots and fighting the spread of the flu can help ease the stress put on our hospital systems across the state.   https://t.co/VCUqAlIOkt

The financial hardships caused by COVID-19 creates greater risk of homelessness & in turn a greater risk of contracting and spreading the coronavirus for some families. This funding provides additional resources to prevent & respond to those challenges. https://t.co/aKJGUYW5AO
Every single Senate Democrat just voted to block Covid-19 relief. Don’t for a second think this isn’t all about politics. https://t.co/NmMI2BHSNW
if China fails to cooperate and provide a full accounting of the events leading up to the outbreak of COVID-19. The world deserves the truth. 2/2 https://t.co/oPp0FE8AGE
100 Accomplishments in 100 Days  Holding China Accountable: Lead cosponsor on the COVID-19 Accountability Act authorizing the President to impose sanctions on the People’s Republic of China 1/2

Children who rely on federal nutrition programs will continue to need that support whether their schools are open or offering online courses. The USDA has adapted policies to meet the need & that flexibility should continue through COVID-19.  https://t.co/zysbD1gqtr

This funding gives these Mississippi schools resources to help students navigate post-secondary education requirements which will be further complicated by the coronavirus pandemic over the next few semesters. https://t.co/1m5cqGfEoZ
Mississippi needs every doctor we can get right now and we shouldn’t allow COVID-19 to disrupt these training programs.  https://t.co/HdwD4NfGOF

100 Accomplishments in 100 Days  RURAL HOSPITALS: Securing funds to support our hospitals has been a top priority. We have delivered over $625 million to assist hospitals and community health centers in Mississippi as we combat the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/qeEYZv3sF6

The troubles caused by skyrocketing drug prices are a never-ending source of hardship for many Mississippians and the threat of the coronavirus pandemic has only increased concerns about drug pricing. https://t.co/r4zwSv6Oaw

Rural healthcare was already in crisis prior to the COVID-19 pandemic and the situation is only getting worse. We must deliver relief to our struggling rural health care providers. https://t.co/Op6nVuZivz
As we battle our way through the coronavirus threat this legislation will help ensure that telehealth is available to seniors in underserved communities. https://t.co/nEkRoz7aFX

National service volunteers have strong records for providing critical assistance in times of crisis. Expanding this sector will help communities & states overcome the hardships created by the coronavirus especially in rural & underserved areas.   https://t.co/yxBG8Td5NN

Catfish producers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic have the opportunity to provide information on why they should be eligible for economic assistance through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to the @USDA. The deadline to submit comments is June 22. https://t.co/tY67L7thce
I’ll be joining @thejtshow on @supertalk today at 11:05 a.m. Be sure to tune in as we discuss the latest Covid-19 legislation and guidelines.
This funding provides rural health clinics with the resources and flexibility to enhance their testing capabilities to fight COVID-19. (Source WJTV) https://t.co/g6wJWayqP2

The Democrats now want to grant illegal immigrants amnesty and protect the employers who hire an illegal workforce all in the name of coronavirus. We will not let this happen. RT if you agree! https://t.co/qrtQK9P5iy

People living in rural areas must continue to have access to care. That won’t happen if more rural hospitals are pushed to close due to COVID-19. This bill recognizes the threat this pandemic poses to rural America & does something to fix the problem. https://t.co/GkzjnD6wcN

The severe flooding and historic tornadoes in Mississippi during just this year alone add to the hardships associated with COVID-19. This bill would expedite efforts to deliver assistance to those who need it most. https://t.co/WN5Vqfcff1

Restaurant closures have reduced the demand for MS seafood products & placed severe stress on the seafood supply chain. We've requested that Sec. Perdue use his authority to purchase & distribute MS seafood to those in need during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/pzWReTcqeP

This bill provides flexibility for local governments to use the funding and helps avoid states expanding the size of state government by creating new unnecessary programs just to be able to spend emergency COVID assistance. (Source WTVA) https://t.co/EK8NDfbeJP

MS counties are seeing COVID-19 cost consume their budgets. Our state & local leaders want to avoid layoffs disrupting essential services or raising taxes. This bill is a good-faith effort to help communities counties & states weather this emergency. https://t.co/WEykxRLfJs
Look at all the spending unrelated to Coronavirus in Pelosi's bill.  RT to inform others. https://t.co/OAHp8uYwen

It is essential to restore a reasonable degree of transparency in the cattle marketplace. Producers deserve fair and transparent pricing and it is apparent in this COVID-19 pandemic that packers are taking advantage of producers.  https://t.co/7liH9FSbD7
Happy to join the @paulgalloshow this morning at 8:05 a.m. on @supertalk to discuss Covid-19 updates and our recent work in the Senate. Be sure to tune in!
After beating COVID-19 Chris donated plasma to help save the lives others fighting this virus. Thank you Chris for setting an excellent example for all Mississippians.  https://t.co/g256LUh8wG

Our constitutional rights including the right for law-abiding citizens to bear arms cannot be abandoned with COVID-19 response & relief efforts. We must be vigilant to protect our Second Amendment rights as we continue to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/LPvppuQq6T

The @mspresenters is joining the global #GivingTuesday campaign taking place today in response to the need caused by COVID-19. All donations will go to local arts partners to support artists help them pay bills buy food & support their communities.  https://t.co/bdUKOpWpAd

$55.1 million from the Higher Education Emergency Relief Fund has been allocated to MS Historically Black Colleges & Universities in addition to the $149 million allocated to support MS colleges universities & other schools during the COVID-19 emergency. https://t.co/0jdPQhEyuB

The COVID-19 pandemic doesn’t eliminate the need for necessary infrastructure upgrades at local airports. These grants will help improve safety and efficiency at these facilities. https://t.co/50HEaNUxg9

This is a huge win for small public hospitals in Mississippi and across the country. These critical facilities are suffering financially under restrictions caused by COVID-19. This new funding can provide a lifeline to public hospitals.  https://t.co/2jaWEpIVVK

Effective containment of the coronavirus will rely on more testing and tracing. The CDC is providing resources to states to use public health systems to accelerate this process which will help move us to a point where we can safely reopen our economy. https://t.co/m52lrdMUTx

Our agriculture and livestock producers share in the extraordinary hard times facing our nation today. The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program will help support these operations and the products they produce to feed and clothe Americans.  https://t.co/B8ZgS8E5DS

Please take a look at the Federal Rural Resources Guide released by the USDA. This guide can help connect you with support available throughout the Covid-19 crisis. RT to help inform other rural Mississippians.  https://t.co/fvrqY9UfVr

This funding will cover healthcare expenses or lost revenue associated with testing and treating coronavirus patients. These payments will help hospitals and providers especially those in rural areas treat the uninsured without taking a financial hit.  https://t.co/fZDYP01Xr8

Wet markets are breeding grounds for the kind of disastrous diseases that kill tens of thousands of people around the world. COVID-19 is just the latest and most severe example. We should do everything possible to stop this cycle of disease and death. https://t.co/LRKksNqRI5

Our community health centers are on the front lines of testing and treating patients for COVID-19. These grants represent an initial distribution of federal funding to support their work in these challenging times. RT to spread the word. https://t.co/dVPfraLnYT
Seniors who are Medicare beneficiaries are especially vulnerable to the coronavirus. We must make sure they are protected and receiving the care they need. https://t.co/tsEyI3xAHn

I commend the Navy for its foresight in advancing this contract work. The economic disruption caused by COVID-19 cannot be allowed to threaten our national security or the industries that supply the products that keep our fighting forces well-equipped. https://t.co/rkQHs5QjpU

Please take a moment to review the latest coronavirus guidelines announced by @realDonaldTrump. We all must do our part. #SlowtheSpread https://t.co/7qa2B3VOxV
